sub_title: Application Developer & System Administrator at ESA/ESTEC
summary:
In brief: I started programming when I was very young, creating many incomplete textual adventures and classic math problems solver, then the game turned into passion and quickly into my job, leaving untouched the fun. Starting from the first serious experiences inside the EDP department of the Italian Ministry of Aeronautics, then hired in a small (but open-minded) company where I had professionally grown up as developer and project manager. 

During the military service I learned some fundamentals truths about life: multiplicity of perspectives is a good thing, the creative approach is a key for solving problems and engineers are often as weird as they worth.

Then, in the following 15 years I demonstrated my abilities as developer and gradually as a software engineer. I built software in many domains, primarily written in Java or for the web, but also dealing with plenty of IT environment and technology combinations. I designed concrete solutions looking at theoretical guidelines, always aiming at having the best reliable final product. 

Recently I moved into The Netherlands, first working as developer for an online travel agency (which has an impressive software stack) and eventually at ESA, where my responsibilities are much more wide open.

During these years I've learned how to manage the entire project lifecycle, from requirement analysis up to software deployment, passing through customer relationship, planning and even helpdesk. I've worked alone or in small teams, I got tasks assigned and I assigned tasks.

I'm very keen to share my knowledge (I tutored my students and taught a basic java course), I love confront people challenging my ideas to make them better, I enjoy being a moderator but I'm also able to take practical decisions when deadline is close by. 

I'm curious about (a bit of) everything, very passionate about technology, good writer, amateur photographer and open-minded music listener.

certifications.name: Sun Certified Programmer For Java 2 Platform, Standard Edition 5.0

projects.title: “SmartStickers” - Experimental digital postcards platform
projects.description:
My responsibilities: requirements analysis, design, development

SmartStickers.it was born as an experimental product intended to consumer marketplace. The main idea is to offer a simple way to deliver funny messages through unique QR codes (but without mobile app). A web interface optimized for mobile devices allows to setup a message per QR code and the postcard's theme. After the setup is completed the message is read only. 

System: Mobile web browsers (iPhone, Android, Windows phone)
Programming language: Javascript and standard web languages, Java 6
Database: MongoDB (NoSQL)
Application server: Tomcat 7
Main technologies and libraries: Stripes framework (now Atalassian), MongoDB drivers, JSP, jQuery Mobile

contributors.headline: Application Developer & System Administrator at ESA/ESTEC

projects.title: “Wonderqrcode.com” - Advanced QR code generator
projects.description:
My responsibilities: server-side design and development, participation in client-side development.

Wonderqrcode is a QR code generator which is able to "blend" traditionals black squares with a background image, keeping the QR code itself still readable. 
My main job was to create a scalable API server which expose their services through RESTful URLs and JSON data. 
To maximize performance we used Amazon AWS infrastructure: EC2 linux server, S3 for storage and web hosting and DynamoDB for data (NoSQL database). On client side we built a javascript application which runs entirely in the browser.

System: Web browsers, Amazon Linux distro
Programming languages: Javascript, standard web languages, Java 7
Database: DynamoDB (NoSQL)
Main technologies and libraries: Amazon AWS sdk (S3, DynamoDB), Jetty-Embedded, Java-servlet 3.1, Jackson (JSON serialization), RequireJS, RaphaelJS, jQuery

contributors.headline: Application Developer & System Administrator at ESA/ESTEC

projects.title: “Qingers” - Mobile advertising platform based on QR Codes
projects.description:
My responsibilities: participation in requirements analysis, design, development and testing

Qingers is a web application created to offer a quick platform where publish announcements targeted to mobile devices and reachable by QR Codes. 
The core server manages all application's features, and exposes stateless APIs via RESTful URLs which work with JSON over HTTP.
Two web application communicate with the core server, one is the backend management GUI (who allows subscribers to manage their announcements and view statistics), the other one is responsible to serve announcements to the different viewers (both desktops or mobiles) coming from short URLs and to collect visitors data. 

Despite Qingers was born as b2b service, it has acquired later a b2c orientation, and then a dedicated website (http://www.qingers.com)

System: Web browsers, Windows
Programming languages: Java 6, javascript and other standard web languages
Database: PostgreSQL 9
Application server: JBoss 7, Tomcat 8
Environment: Amazon EC2
Main technologies and libraries: jackson (JSON serialization), apache-httpclient, apache wicket 6, myBatis

contributors.headline: Application Developer & System Administrator at ESA/ESTEC

projects.title: "Taskalo" - Task-oriented time tracker for internal use
projects.description:
My responsibilities: participation in requirements analysis, design, development and testing.

This web application has been created in order to replace old time-tracking methods and softwares, and to aid the administration office with reports useful to billing activities. 
It enables to each technician to associate his hours within the working days to a specific task, having a clear evidence of how many hours have been already spent (himself or collegues) in order to remain within assigned budget. 

System: Web browsers, Windows
Programming languages: Java 5, standard web languages
Database: PostgreSQL 9.0
Application server: Tomcat 7
Main technologies & libraries: Apache Wicket 5, jQuery, myBatis

contributors.headline: Application Developer & System Administrator at ESA/ESTEC

projects.title: "CWTPayAdv" - Automatic document manager software for Carlson Wagonlit Travel
projects.description:
My responsibilities: participation in design, development and testing.

A service software which is listening for new documents from ad-hoc folder or email address. Each new document is parsed, classified and sent to a specific workflow module. 
Some documents like invoices and VAT-related documentation are decorated and then converted to PDF/a for substitutive storage purpose (in collaboration with Imaging Group Spa).
Other documents like payment notices are splitted and published online in order to be seen by CWT's customers via the web interface created at http://www.aminformatica.it/cwt-pagamenti/ 

System: Windows, Web browsers
Programming languages: Java 5, standard web languages
Database: MySql 5
Application server: Tomcat 6
Main technologies & libraries: Java threads, Apache Wicket 1.4, iText & PDFBox, JavaMail

contributors.headline: Application Developer & System Administrator at ESA/ESTEC

projects.title: “Medusa2” - Bill of materials (BOM) costs analysis and price development system for LSG Sky Chefs Spa
projects.description:
My responsibilities: project management, requirements analysis, design, development & testing.

Medusa2 is a web application integrated to the legacy ERP system on iSeries created in order to enhance costing and pricing departments capabilities. It allows article master data maintenance and bill of materials (the meals sold to customers) composition, with useful tools to measure material and labor costs in real time. 
The pricing area helps users to create catalog of meals for customers, considering margin analysis on sales volume forecast (based on planned flights)

Its development has requested an extensive work in order to make this web application more responsive as possible without using nothing but standard web programming languages (HTML+CSS+JS) 

System: Web browsers, Windows, iSeries
Programming languages: Java 5, HTML+CSS+JS, RPG/400
Database: integrated DB2/400
Application server: Tomcat 6/7
Main technologies & libraries: Apache Wicket 1.4, iBatis (ORM), iText (PDF), jxl (Excel)

contributors.headline: Application Developer & System Administrator at ESA/ESTEC

projects.title: OpenOffice Writer integration for USI Spa
projects.description:
My responsibilities: requirements analysis, development, testing.

Integration between the main informative system based on IBM iSeries and the modern word processor in order to allow a graphical way to compile medical reports with some facilities.
The system use many advanced features on iSeries (IFS, Java on iSeries, PCCMD) to pre-process templates and give commands to the clients in order to control OpenOffice Writer with the prepared medical report.

System: iSeries, Windows
Programming languages: Java 1.4, RPG/400, CL/400
Main technologies & libraries: iSeries administration tools & API

contributors.headline: Application Developer & System Administrator at ESA/ESTEC

projects.title: Web site framework for internal use
projects.description:
My responsibilities: participation in requirements analysis, design, development

We built a developer-oriented framework in order to have useful tools to build simple websites. The final result is a platform SEO frienldy with a templating system, integrated multilingual support and custom taglib library.
(old examples: http://www.aminformatica.it and http://refertionline.usi.it) 

Programming languages: Java 5, HTML+CSS+JS
Main technologies & libraries:  JSP, JSTL, XML, Java Servlet and Taglib, Apache Velocity

contributors.headline: Application Developer & System Administrator at ESA/ESTEC

projects.title: “OMR” - Medical report online publishing system for USI Spa.
projects.description:
My responsibilities: participation in design, development in iSeries, participation in java development (signing procedure and web site) and test

The system is composed by three separate modules which communicate each other. Each medical report borns on the iSeries; if it is eligible for online publishing it is sent to a PC equipped with smart card reader, then it is digitally signed by a doctor through a simplified "review & confirm" program written in Java.
When the medical report is confirmed it is published online (and its owner is notified by SMS). The patient can access to http://refertionline.usi.it with his own credentials, and then he can download the digital signed copy of his medical reports.

System: Windows, iSeries, web browsers
Programming language: Java 6, HTML+CSS+JS, RPG/400
Database: integrated DB2/400
Application server: Tomcat 6
Main technologies & libraries: Java, Swing, JSP, Java Servlet, SmartCard related libraries, BouncyCastle, iText (PDF), xStream 1.3

contributors.headline: Application Developer & System Administrator at ESA/ESTEC

projects.title: "Eva" - Advanced alerts manager system for internal use
projects.description:
My responsibilities: requirements analysis, design, development, testing and user support. 
In second part of the project I also led 2-members team.

The software was required from the helpdesk department to help in gathering notifications from multiple monitoring sources and to filter, manipulate and deliver alerts according to preset configuration. 

In its final form the project is able to receive alerts from different sources (both HW and SW) via ad-hoc connectors and manage them using smart logics in order to merge/ignore/interpolate alert's content and deliver the proper notifications via SMS or email to customer or internal technician. 
A remote UI dashboard built in second part of the project is able to connect to the central in order to show the customer's network and its status in real time.
For this scope a small communication framework based on XML over HTTP was developed. 

Systems: Windows, Linux
Programming languages: Java 5
Database: MySql 5
Main technologies & libraries: Java threads, XML, HTTP, SNMP, SQL, xStream 1.3

contributors.headline: Application Developer & System Administrator at ESA/ESTEC

projects.title: “DemoManager” -Equipment demonstrations planning software for Toshiba Medical System Italy
projects.description:
My responsibilities: design, development and testing.
In second part of the project I led the customization and installation of "DemoManager" for French and German division of Toshiba Medical System.

DemoManager is a web application designed to manage time frames allocations of equipments intended for demo at the customer's site.
The warehouse manager can view and set the availability of equipments and accessories, print delivery notes and make some reports.

System: Windows, Browsers (IE6)
Programming language: Java 5, HTML/CSS/JS, SQL
Database: MySql 5
Application server: Tomcat 6
Main technologies & libraries: Apache Wicket 1.3, iText (PDF)

contributors.headline: Application Developer & System Administrator at ESA/ESTEC

projects.title: Integration of EU Labelling regulation in local software for LSG Sky Chefs Italy
projects.description:
My responsibilities: project management, requirements analysis, design, development and testing

The project's main goal is the bidirectional integration of local and head office informative systems (respectively Medusa2 and CBase) in order to supply a continuously information flow about allergens. Without these information the production department cannot prepare and bring onboard meals for scheduled and last minute flights. 

The resulting solution is a near-realtime system which is able to inspect BOMs and recipes in order to collect ingredients and manage substitutions in case of missing components; detect changes and produce automatically new XML interface files which are sent to head office system through an SFTP server.

An extensive job has been done to reduce to the minimum the procedure's impact for production departments. 

System: Windows, iSeries
Programming languages: Java 5, RPG/400, standard web languages
Database: DB2/400
Application server: Tomcat 7
Main technologies & libraries: xStream, Apache Wicket 1.4, JDBC400,

projects.title: “USP” - Integrated sales cycle management software for Toshiba Medical System Italy
projects.description:
My responsibilities: development of data migration procedure and some tiny custom frameworks, development of many functional parts.

The software is designed as integrated layer to the preexisting informative system based on IBM's ACG suite. Its goals are margin analysis, tenders's draft, accounting links, communication with legacy systems and many others.

During the following years I followed its maintenance as main developer and then as analyst. 

Systems: IBM iSeries, Windows XP/Vista/7
Programming language: RPG/400, Java 1.4
Database: DB2/400, Oracle
Application server: JBoss 3-4
Main technologies & libraries: EJB, Swing, JDom, iText (pdf), Java Web Start, iBatis (OR mapping tools)
